title: Legal Counsel (Assistant Manager)
company_info: Leveraging over 100 years’ of experience, TVS Supply Chain Solutions (SCS) draw on our deep Asian heritage and expertise to unlock innovative supply chain solutions for our evolving world. Where some see complexity, we see opportunity. We innovate and deliver at pace. This gives you direct ‘one point’ access to extend coverage, leading technology and service excellence. From freight forwarding to last mile solutions, we’re fully scaled to take care of your toughest business challenges.
address: TVS SCS LOGISTICS CENTRE, 21 CHANGI NORTH WAY 498774
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for qualified candidates to join us as a Legal Counsel (Assistant Manager) based in Changi North.

Responsibilities
Responsible for drafting, reviewing and negotiating a wide range of contracts (Singapore and regional) with third parties including contracts with customers and vendors, tender bundles, leases, non-disclosure agreements, letter of offers
Manage contractual issues and disputes, including liaising with external counsel and settlement of legal invoices
Manage and provide sound and business-oriented legal support and guidance to the various business units on a wide variety of local and regional matters of the TVSSCS GFS Group entities in and outside Singapore
Work closely with the business functions to ensure compliance with the applicable rules, laws and regulations and the Group’s policies, and mitigate business risks with effective legal strategies and solutions
Manage, including working with external service providers, all aspects of corporate secretarial matters of the Group
Support shareholders’ and directors’ meetings, including organization and documentation
Provide corporate secretarial support to business and management, including but not limited to KYC checks, attending to auditors’ requests and bank accounts updates.
Updating and maintenance of statutory/regulatory and corporate records
Provide legal administration services to, and overseeing document and record management and other administrative processes of the Legal/Corp Sec department
Maintain the Group's Legal Records and Archive
Assist in any assigned ad-hoc duties/projects
Qualifications and Experiences
Degree in Law or relevant course of study
Minimum 1 to 2 years of work experience in Freight / Logistics industry is preferred
Regional experience across APAC is advantageous
Excellent legal analytical, drafting and negotiation skills
Strong business acumen to understand business goals and strategy
Strong problem solving skills
Ability to exercise sound commercial judgement when balancing legal risks against business benefits
High degree of professional ethics, integrity and accountability
Good communications and interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
A dynamic and adaptable team-player
Able to work independently and under pressure

title: Assistant Accountant (Legal,Admin)
company_info: The Pokémon Company is a company that produces the worldwide brand Pokémon. This global phenomenon has amassed over 6.0 trillion yen in market size with an estimate of 65% overseas. Pokémon Center Singapore is the first Pokémon Center opened outside of Japan. The Singapore branch offers an array of Pokémon merchandise sold in Japan such as toys, stationeries, video games, trading card games and many more, as well as original merchandises that are exclusive to Singapore!
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Admin / Secretarial, Legal
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position: Assistant Accountant (Legal / Admin)

Job Description:
As the Assistant Accountant with a focus on admin and legal matters, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of the financial and administrative functions of the company.
Your responsibilities will include, but not limited to:
Financial Support:
Assist overseas finance team in various accounting tasks, including bookkeeping, financial reporting, and data entry.
Manage accounts payable and receivable, ensuring accurate and timely processing of invoices and payments.
Liaise with headquarter (Japan)’s accounting team for various financial matters.
Administrative Duties:
Oversee general office administrative tasks, including managing office and expat residence leasing, supplies.
Organize and maintain electronic and physical filing systems to ensure easy retrieval of documents.
Legal Matters:
Assist in the preparation and review of legal documents, contracts, and agreements.
Manage business licenses for products and merchandise sold by the company.
Liaise with headquarters and external legal counsel and regulatory authorities as necessary.
Keep up to date with relevant laws and regulations to ensure compliance.
Japanese translation and interpretation:
Provide accurate and timely translations from Japanese to English and vice versa.
Translate various documents, emails and reports as required.
Provide accurate interpretation during business meetings.
Act as primary point of contact for communication with headquarter (Japan) in ensuring effective and precise exchange of information.
Requirement:
Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
To communicate effectively with headquarter (Japan) team, high proficiency in Japanese and English, both written and spoken, with strong translation skills is a must.
At least 5 years of experience in accounting and finances
Knowledge of Japanese business culture and practices is highly desirable.
Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and the ability to meet deadlines.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Legal Assistant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

· Work with trial attorneys on all phrases of trial
· Assist in preparation of document for court filings
· Engage in online research
· Contact court administrators and regulatory bodies as needed to fulfil job assignment
· Act as a liaison with designated outside counsel and their paralegal staff and internally between departments

title: Legal Counsel (Ship Owner)
company_info: Our team has more than 10 years of experience in recruitment. We are passionate and committed in this fast-paced and ever-changing environment. We believe in prioritising our talents as much as our clients and let our actions speak for us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Collaboration
• Offer the commercial departments' chartering and operations teams, as well as the commercial departments as a whole, immediate legal support.
• Assist commercial teams in finding solutions to controversial problems, including providing timely advice on risk mitigation, tactical and strategic problems, and appropriate escalation.

Legal Support
• Coordinating commercial teams, insurers, clubs, and outside counsel as necessary. Daily handling of formal dispute proceedings in multiple jurisdictions.
• Draft, examine, and provide advice on legal documents (such as charter agreements, service agreements, agreements for the purchase or rental of equipment, shipbuilding contracts, etc.), as well as help with their negotiation when necessary.
• As needed, offer legal assistance with particular projects like buying businesses or assets.
• Relationships with other parties, such as insurers and support providers, should be maintained and developed.

Qualifications
• English or Singapore qualified lawyer.
• At least 5– 8 years PQE gained in the shipping department of an international law firm.
• Experience in a P&I/FD&D club or ship-owner preferred.

title: Executive Assistant, Legal
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The incumbent will provide secretarial and legal administration support to the Vice President of Legal who is based in Singapore. This EA position calls for strong business ethics, discretion and confidentiality in handling day to day matters supporting senior executives and their broader team members (where needed). A good understanding of business vocabulary, detailed knowledge of the organization’s operations, procedures and people.

Key Responsibilities
Diary ownership and management for the Legal Vice President, who is the International Markets leader with responsibility over parts of APAC, EU/UK and North America markets
Liaison with fellow Executive Assistants and Senior Leaders around the Globe to enable effective operating rhythms across multiple time zones
Responsibility for taking action items of meetings and following up action items in between meetings to ensure completion
Development of PowerPoint presentations for key meetings
Management of expense accounts, tracking of expenditure and expense processing
Travel arrangement support for the Executives and VIPs (where required) – flight bookings, hotel, meals and car booking to ensure efficiency and sensible use of the Executives’ time.
Assist on visa application as well for invitation letters and dispatch letters
Event organization and management of leadership team offsites and events
Facilitate smooth communication flow with other senior executives, managers and employees internally as well as external parties such as media and customers. Call screening, transmit messages, handling mail services, receiving VIPs, organizing logistics of regular and ad-hoc team meetings e.g. Legal All-Hands, Leadership meetings etc. Audio/video conference calls set-up with reminders and relevant logistics support.
Legal administration support including, among other things, tracking of outside counsel spend, facilitating payment of outside counsel invoices, arranging for signing and dispatch of legal documents, arranging for filing of documents with regulatory authorities, supporting board meetings.
Key Skills and Experience
Relevant Executive Assistant experience supporting Senior Leaders in a multi-national company
Paralegal experience preferred but not essential
Outstanding planning and organizing skills
Proactivity - able to think ahead and anticipate what might happen. Ability to work under pressure.
Outstanding verbal and written communicator
Team player – high energy and passionate about impacting team dynamics
Strong PowerPoint, Excel and Word Skills
Strong attention to detail and care about quality of work

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Working with senior management to develop and implement policies and actions;
Drafting of regulatory instruments such as legislations and subsidiary legislations
Providing legal advice and interpretation with respect to various legislations administered by the client, as well as all other laws of Singapore as required by the client in the discharge of its duties and functions;
Drafting, reviewing and providing sound legal advice on a broad range of legal issues;
Drafting, vetting and advising on general corporate and contractual matters including, but not limited to, tender documents, MOUs, tenancy agreements and other commercial documents;
Developing and setting in place internal legal processes and guidance for the various Divisions and GROs, including setting up a repository of legal advice rendered to the client; and
Undertaking such other tasks/projects as may be assigned from time to time.
Work Schedule:
Salary: Monthly Rated
Working Hours:
Mon to Thurs 8.5hrs
Fri 8hrs
Location: Jalan Besar
Contract Duration: 3 Years

Job Requirements:
• A law degree and be called to the Singapore Bar (or other commonwealth jurisdictions)
• At least 4-years post qualification experience (PQE)
• Corporate work experience (especially in contract law) would be an advantage.
• Versatile and self-motivated with strong analytical skills
• Able and willing to multi-task and work well under pressure handling a wide range of legal work
• Good communication and interpersonal skills; the ability to write and reason clearly and compellingly is essential

title: Senior Legal Counsel
company: ENGIE SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: ENGIE Services Asia-Pacific is the holding Company of the regional ENGIE Services Business Units and is headquartered in Singapore, with strong regional presence in ASEAN countries like Malaysia, Thailand and Philippines. ENGIE Services is an accredited Energy Services Company (ESCO) and has key delivery capability and expertise in energy and environment management. At the heart of our success is a commitment to delivering harmonised and integrated solutions that support our Customers’ activities, drive cost from their businesses and add value to their operations. Our priority is to understand each Customer’s requirements and to build and deliver the right solution to their expectations. We provide a blend of service elements that integrates seamlessly with our Customer’s core business and optimise efficiencies, as well as meeting all legislative, operational and sustainability imperatives, within a clearly defined service agreement. We also understand the importance of having a proven quality, environment and safety management system and we are proud to have been accredited with ISO 9001, ISO 14001, OHSAS: 180001. As an accredited Energy Services Company (ESCO) since 2005, ENGIE has key delivery capability and expertise in energy and environment management. ENGIE delivers harmonized and integrated solutions that support clients’ activities; drive cost from their businesses while adding value to their operations. About ENGIE Group ENGIE develops its businesses (power, natural gas, energy services) around a model based on responsible growth to take on the major challenges of energy’s transition to a low-carbon economy: access to sustainable energy, climate-change mitigation and adaptation and the rational use of resources. The Group provides individuals, cities and businesses with highly efficient and innovative solutions largely based on its expertise in four key sectors: renewable energy, energy efficiency, liquefied natural gas and digital technology. ENGIE employs 154,950 people worldwide and achieved revenues of €69.9 billion in 2015. The Group is listed on the Paris and Brussels stock exchanges (ENGI) and is represented in the main international indices: CAC 40, BEL 20, DJ Euro Stoxx 50, Euronext 100, FTSE Eurotop 100, MSCI Europe, DJSI World, DJSI Europe and Euronext Vigeo (Eurozone 120, Europe 120 and France 20). Specialties Energy Audit, ESD Consultancy, Project Management, Facility Services, Energy Efficiency Performance Contract, Data Centre Services, Street Lighting Services, Integrated Facilities Management
address: GOLDEN AGRI PLAZA, 108 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 118535
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Provide legal assistance on all legal matters including development of Greenfields and brownfields projects, due diligence exercises, partnerships and commercial contracts in the South East Asia Cluster.

Corporate housekeeping

title: Legal Assistant (Law Firm) / Bilingual / Diploma / 1 Yr Exp / Central
company_info: Reich Consultancy is an independent Consultancy with a team of professional and experienced Consultants, the majority of whom have joined the company with excellent industry expertise. Honesty and integrity are part of our core value, while we strive to offer an approach that is transparent to all parties involved. We offer guidance and provide opportunities to aid in the progression of your career. We strive to ensure that the job requirements match your skills set and career expectation.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
Maintain and ensure the accuracy of legal files, both physical and electronic, by organizing them systematically, indexing documents, and implementing version control procedures.
Create, update, and manage document templates, forms, and legal databases to facilitate efficient workflow and retrieval of information.
Assist in managing attorney calendars, including scheduling appointments, coordinating meetings, and sending out reminders.
Arrange conference calls and video conferences, ensuring all relevant parties are informed and well-prepared for seamless communication.
Professionally handle incoming calls, accurately record messages, and direct inquiries to the appropriate individuals.
Provide general administrative support, such as photocopying, scanning, and mailing documents as needed.
Maintain up-to-date contact lists, client databases, and legal libraries to ensure accessibility and accuracy of information.

Requirements:
Minimum Diploma or equivalent in a relevant field.
Previous experience of 1-2 years as a legal secretary or in a similar role within a law firm, legal department, or related setting.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Strong organizational skills, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey information clearly and professionally.

Interested applicants, please write in through Jobsbank with detailed resume in MS Words format.
